item.title: Using Google's Smart Search
item.description:
Find people, place and things in your photos.
Smart search allows you to search for anything. A friend's name, a location, a color; the options are endless. This channel supports all of these searches!
To apply names to faces: STEP 1: Open https://photos.google.com/search or Google Photos smartphone app. STEP 2: Tap the search bar and select a face. At the top click [Who's this?]
For more details: https://support.google.com/photos/answer/6128838

item.title: Screensaver for Google Photos
item.description:
Built into this Roku channel is a screensaver which lets you stream your photos while the device is inactive.
To enable screensaver: STEP 1: Roku Home > Settings > Screensaver > select [PhotoView for Google Photos] STEP 2: In the Custom Settings, select a linked account (if you have multiple) STEP 3: Back out to [Wait time] and ensure screensaver is active
For more details: https://support.roku.com/article/212015418

item.title: Setting up Albums in Google Photos
item.description:
Photo albums let you organize your photos quickly and easily. You no longer have to break out the glue gun and it's much more powerful than your grandmother's dusty album book!
On the Google Photos site or smartphone app, simply create an album and select the photos you want added. You may also add text and locations to help you with searching later on. (See 'Smart Search' tip)
Ten years down the road, you'll be happy the photos are organized and easily found.
For more details: https://support.google.com/photos/answer/6128849

item.title: Where are my Shared Albums?
item.description:
Google Photos API does not currently support retrieving of albums which are shared to you. As of this writing, Google has no plans on adding this feature.
We still have our fingers crossed this will one day work and encourage you to voice your support!
For more details: https://developers.google.com/picasa-web/faq

item.title: What happened to Tags and Favorites?
item.description:
When Picasa finally shutdown in 2016, in lieu of Google Photos, Google removed some functionality. Tags, Favorites and Community Searching were the most notable; not including the beloved desktop application.
Give albums a try if you have not already done so. They are very powerful and serve much the same purposes as tags/favorites did.
